description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7i9k3","text":"APEX2-based proximity labeling for the discovery of proteins proximal to NLRP3. Aspects of this APEX2 protocol can be applied to other target proteins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: Proximity biotinylation of ATG8 proteins and selective autophagy receptors

related_materials.name: Pierce™ High pH Reversed-Phase Peptide Fractionation Kit

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6t8pm","text":"The choice of cells, constructs, proximity biotinylation enzyme (e.g., TurboID vs. APEX2), treatments, etc. to employ for proximity biotinylation experiments depends on the experimental design. Here, mouse immortalized bone-marrow derived macrophages iBMDM cells (Gift from Kate Fitzgerald), either wild-type or Nlrp3-knockout, were reconstituted with Nlrp3-APEX2-FLAG-IRES-GFP (Addgene #218633) or FLAG-APEX2-P4C-IRES-mNeonGreen (Addgene #218646). Adherent cells are important for the washing steps of this protocol, but it can be adapted for suspension cells with the addition of spin steps during quenching. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgepu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bh4cl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5861q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6i8ud","text":"Add 10 μL biotin phenol (BP, 500 mM) to cells 45 mins prior to collecting them. For example, for 4 h LPS priming only, add BP to plates 3 h 15 min after LPS. For a 30 min nigericin treatment, add BP to plates 3 h 45 min after LPS treatment, nigericin at 4 h LPS, and collect cells 30 min later.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rsqc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mpve","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"51soj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"BP is not very soluble in cell culture medium and will likely crash out before dissolving into solution, so add it to the cells while swirling the plate and continue swirling until all it goes into solution.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62ka2","text":"These cell lines were grown in Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM, high glucose and pyruvate) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum, GlutaMAX‱, and Penicillin-Streptomycin. They were maintained in a 5% CO2 incubator at 37 oC. iBMDMs were split 1:10 every other day, but growth rates vary among different cell types and passages.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":213,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":231,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":150,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"83FBE018F6A211EEAF630A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/35050061"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"m40i","text":"The appropriate iBMDMs were spinfected with Nlrp3-APEX2-FLAG-IRES-GFP (Addgene #218633) or FLAG-APEX2-P4C-IRES-mNeonGreen (Addgene #218646). 3 - 5 d after spinfection, cells were bulk sorted for low GFP+/mNeonGreen+ expressors with a Sony SH800 Cell Sorter operating in purity mode.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49fju","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7nni","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ebo7u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egc00","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":425,"offset":60}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"An extended protocol for producing virus is available here: https://www.addgene.org/protocols/lentivirus-production/?utm_term=\u0026utm_campaign=Primary+Ad+Group:+Website,+blog,+collections.\u0026utm_source=adwords\u0026utm_medium=ppc\u0026hsa_acc=3245806047\u0026hsa_cam=112133441\u0026hsa_grp=63724608643\u0026hsa_ad=320492093642\u0026hsa_src=g\u0026hsa_tgt=dsa-596073738403\u0026hsa_kw=\u0026hsa_mt=\u0026hsa_net=adwords\u0026hsa_ver=3\u0026gad_source=1\u0026gclid=Cj0KCQjwztOwBhD7ARIsAPDKnkBDRe1ZLOhpLmjku0S2lwpO2RobkQ5ylaJPMUZ4Sofxe5MhJOULGNAaAvVrEALw_wcB","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"2B76BA1FF6A011EEAF630A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/lentivirus-production/?utm_term=\u0026utm_campaign=Primary+Ad+Group:+Website,+blog,+collections.\u0026utm_source=adwords\u0026utm_medium=ppc\u0026hsa_acc=3245806047\u0026hsa_cam=112133441\u0026hsa_grp=63724608643\u0026hsa_ad=320492093642\u0026hsa_src=g\u0026hsa_tgt=dsa-596073738403\u0026hsa_kw=\u0026hsa_mt=\u0026hsa_net=adwords\u0026hsa_ver=3\u0026gad_source=1\u0026gclid=Cj0KCQjwztOwBhD7ARIsAPDKnkBDRe1ZLOhpLmjku0S2lwpO2RobkQ5ylaJPMUZ4Sofxe5MhJOULGNAaAvVrEALw_wcB"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"di7vf","text":"Check protein expression levels by comparing LPS-primed WT iBMDMs to LPS-primed Nlrp3-APEX2-FLAG iBMDMs using Western blot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9kf9","text":"Check protein localization by IF using an anti-FLAG antibody.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ljv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5ufa","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"msvh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"An extended protocol for immunofluorescence is available here: dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.kxygxyeeol8j/v1","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5cmdu","text":"Validate functional reconstitution of Nlrp3-APEX2 in Nlrp3-KO iBMDMs with LDH release.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"diq30","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1c0r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5k7vs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"An extended protocol for LDH and IL-1β release is available here: dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.kxygxyeeol8j/v1","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bkfro","text":"Grow cells to just fully confluent in 10-cm dishes. For certain iBMDMs, for example, a 1:10 split produces a fully confluent dish 2 d later. Cells should be seeded in 10 mL complete DMEM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vgv0","text":"For the cell harvesting day, freshly prepare: 100X Trolox in DMSO (500 mM, requires sonication), 100X Sodium ascorbate in PBS (1 M), 100X sodium azide in PBS (1 M). Each of these solutions is 1:100X, so prepare enough for the amount of quenching buffer used (35 mL buffer per replicate).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e22kf","text":"Just before harvesting the cells, prepare the following: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fk6qi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tulo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ol7u","text":"Prepare the following ahead of time: Biotin-phenol/biotin tyramide (500 mM in DMSO, aliquot, store at -80 °C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":106,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8g7fj","text":"Stagger treatments so that only 3-4 plates (for example, 1 group of replicates) are harvested at a time. For inflammasome treatments, this could mean staggering LPS treatments for different conditions by 1 h. Regardless, replace the medium with 10 mL fresh DMEM/etc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eueo9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5j06g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3riov","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"When treating cells with LPS for inflammasome experiments, exchange the cell culture medium into 10 mL fresh DMEM lacking serum. Serum starvation, plus some degree of contact inhibition from a fully confluent plate, can reduce the amount of mitotic cells and consequently ensure more cells can undergo an NLRP3 response.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eo4do","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"sf1n","text":"All plates should receive fresh medium with the same components, for similar amounts of time, if a media swap occurs. For example, if you want to compare +/- LPS, also swap the -LPS plate into fresh media for 4 h prior to harvesting.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajf3s","text":"100 mM H2O2 in DPBS (10 uL of 30% H2O2 into 990 μL DPBS). Prepare individual pipettes with 100 uL of H2O2 for each plate being harvested at a time. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":8,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":10,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":35,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":37,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":102,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":104,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8817j","text":"3 falcon tubes per plate, with 10 mL ice-cold quenching buffer in each. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frv95","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15b43","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rqoe","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ae7dr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"Make up fresh batches of quenching buffer by diluting 100x Trolox, 100x Sodium ascorbate, and 100X sodium azide into ice-cold PBS with vigorous stirring (to 1X). Each replicate will need 35 mL quencher buffer.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9c87b","text":"Trays of ice for harvesting cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2fjpn","text":"Bring cells to the bench and harvest them (see video and text below).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fuc2i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9jos","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3d9n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bv3p5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7bcu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dlje5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"video","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":0,"id":458759,"is_video":true,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"video/mp4","originalFile":{},"original_name":"APEX_labeling_sample prep_1.mp4","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qaaq98ke.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qaah98ke.mp4","type":3,"width":0}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"In the video, we include an additional PBS wash to remove quencher--this isn't necessary, because the low carryover of quencher will not affect protein quantification with the DC protein assay II kit.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3looi","text":"Prepare lysis buffer: 50 mM Tris HCl pH 7.5, 150 mM NaCl, 1.0% (v/v) SDS, 1.0 % (v/v) NP-40, 1X cOmplete‱ Protease Inhibitor Cocktail","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":104,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":104,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2amat","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ma61","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1E167C60F6A311EEAF630A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"Lysis buffer can be kept slightly chilled but cannot be put on ice, because the 1% SDS will precipitate. Work SDS powder in a hood, if applicable. Detergents and other components can be dissolved overnight, but the protease inhibitor cocktail should be added immediately before proceeding.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1krec","text":"Repeat with additional replicates at staggered timepoints to prevent an overwhelming amount of simultaneous bench work.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"oo38","text":"Pour off the solutions and quickly add ice-cold quencher solution to each plate, and place them on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8o0j5","text":"Aspirate the quencher and wash the plates two additional times. Scrape the cells in the final 10 mL quencher solution, transfer to a falcon tube, and scrape the plates with an additional 5 mL quencher solution to harvest residual cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9kd7g","text":"Centrifuge cells (1000 xg, 5 min), aspirate the quencher solution, and flash-freeze pellets in liquid nitrogen. Store at -80 oC until ready for immunoprecipitation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":125,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"gtqg","text":"Rapidly thaw cell pellets by submerging tubes in warm water for ~30 s, then place them on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9vd1","text":"Gently vortex the stock of magnetic streptavidin beads for ~30 s to thoroughly resuspend them. Aliquot 50 μL beads (slurry) per replicate, and ~10% excess for pipetting loss, into a protein LoBind microcentrifuge tube using a wide bore P1000 pipette tip. Wash 3x with lysis buffer, and then rotate end-over-end while preparing other reagents.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ok81","text":"Quickly pipette H2O2 into each of the plates, swirl, and incubate at RT for 1 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":17,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":19,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eqcgt","text":"Add 1 mL of lysis buffer to each cell pellet and immediately transfer them to microcentrifuge tubes at RT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4n8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emve9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"75t9o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"Upon addition of lysis buffers, pellets will quickly becoming viscous because the loss of nuclear integrity releases DNA. These solutions will be very hard to pipette, so immediately pipette off the pellet into a LoBind tube before pipetting up and down to resuspend the pellet.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kruh","text":"Sonicate each lysate for ~10 seconds with a small probe sonicator. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asfge","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7r6nq","text":"Repeat this step once.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"57che","text":"Add 0.25 μL benzonase to each tube. Invert tubes at RT for 30 min to complete lysis and DNA digestion. The solutions should be much less viscous following sonication and benzonase treatment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1fn8","text":"Spin tubes at 15,000 xg for 10 min. There shouldn't be a large pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2nsv8","text":"Quantify each of the supernatants with the DC protein assay kit II. Use reagent A'.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d16u9","text":"For a fully confluent 10 cm plate lysed in 1 mL, dilute the clarified lysates 1:5 in lysis buffer to be in the linear range of the assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8e3jf","text":"Run a BSA standard curve alongside the APEX2 lysates by diluting 200 mg/mL analytical standard BSA solution to 4 mg/mL in lysis buffer. Perform several 2-fold serial dilutions to make a 6-point curve (4, 2, 1, 0.5, 0.25, 0.125 mg/mL)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"s4ie","text":"Normalize protein concentrations to 2 mg/mL. Prepare a total volume of 1075 μL in fresh protein LoBind microcentrifuge tubes. Remove 75 μL of this solution into pre-prepared microcentrifuge tubes containing 25 μL 4XLDS sample buffer (\"INPUT\" sample).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"674ua","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"93cs8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"","height":0,"id":458774,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet","originalFile":{},"original_name":"normalization_curves_example.xlsx","placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/xlsx.png","raw_source":"","size":0,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qaay98ke.xlsx","type":5,"width":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"566m3","text":"Add 50 μL of bead slurry to each microcentrifuge tube containing 1 mL clarified lysate at 2 mg/mL. Resuspend or invert the beads constantly to ensure they do not settle to the bottom during aliquotting. Invert the mixtures end-over-end for 2 h at RT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ebc0m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fasfb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"gkt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"Note: depending on the washes with lysis buffer, the equivalent volume to achieve 50 μL of slurry per condition might have changed.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a8p5l","text":"Wash the beads thoroughly with several solutions, using a magnetic rack to pellet the beads. Resuspend the magnetic beads with a wide bore pipette when changing solutions and place them on an end-over-end rotator while resuspending all of the replicates. Ensure that the beads don't aggregate, and if they do, gently pipette up and down with a wide bore P1000 to disperse them.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4l9t4","text":"Wash 1: 1 mL lysis buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b7pp1","text":"Wash 2: 1 mL lysis buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2m8o2","text":"Wash 3: 1 mL 1 M KCl","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cf8l8","text":"Wash 4: 1 mL 100 mM Sodium carbonate (Na2CO3)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":40,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":43,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"567i8","text":"Wash 5: 1 mL 2 M urea in 10 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.0)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"am1vr","text":"Wash 6: 1 mL PBS. Use this wash to transfer the beads to new protein low-bind tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"517d1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etui3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dr2vh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"Transferring to new tubes at some point during the washes is important because digestion will be on-bead, and therefore contaminants stuck to the walls of the microcentrifuge tubes can carry-over to the MS data.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"817hi","text":"Wash 7: 1 mL MQ/ultrapure water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45jcl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9h1nm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1a1re","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"If transferring to an MS facility for the on-bead digestion and the remainder of the sample prep, check with them prior to proceeding with the steps below.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"epgrf","text":"Reduction: pellet the beads and resuspend them in 75 μL EPPS pH 8.5 (200 mM) with 1.5 μL TCEP (0.5 M, ~10 mM final). Vortex, and incubate tubes at RT for 30 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0gaa","text":"Alkylation: add 3 μL of freshly prepared 0.5 M chloroacetamide (in water) to each tube (final: ~20 mM). Vortex and incubate for 20 min in the dark (30 minutes max, and longer is bad).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6m0uv","text":"Quench the chloroacetamide with DTT (3.5 μL, 0.5 M), vortex, and pellet on a magnetic rack.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83mqm","text":"Wash beads 2x with 1 mL HPLC water to remove chloroacetamide, TCEP, and DTT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3b4ol","text":"Resuspend beads in 75 μL EPPS supplemented with 1 μL LysC. Shake (600-800 RPM) for 2-4 h at 37 oC (ideally, with a heated lid to prevent evaporation).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":95,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1bbvq","text":"Add 1 μL trypsin per tube. Vortex briefly and shake (600-800 RPM) for 16-24 h at 37 oC (ideally, with a heated lid to prevent evaporation).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":84,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5cked","text":"Vortex beads, pulse centrifuge them, and then put them on a magnetic rack. Remove the digested peptide flow through to a new low-bind microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ebnnh","text":"Wash the beads with 30 μL acetonitrile (ACN), and combine the flow through into the new tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1e3ip","text":"Pellet the combined flow-through on a magnetic rack and take the flow-through, avoiding additional bead carry-over.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gevv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"71eic","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"This additional magnetic rack step is to remove as much bead as possible.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eojes","text":"Add 5 μL TMT label reagent (12.5 μg/μl in ACN) to each vial. Vortex and then shake (600-800 RPM) for 2 h at RT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"anh4i","text":"In the last 30 min of the TMT labeling, prepare a stage tip (6 small cookies from Empore SPE C18 disks, or a commercial C18 column) and equilibrate it:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nsb8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"629is","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"66h5n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"Never let the stage tip completely dry until the elution step","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"546lq","text":"200 μL 100% Methanol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqg0f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"39mp8","text":"200 μL 5% ACN/1% Formic acid (FA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4e1cc","text":"200 μL 80% ACN","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"br4u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7je80","text":"Place 160 μL of 1% FA in a microcentrifuge tube. Pipette 5 μL (~5 % of output) of each labeled sample into tube, vortex, and then proceed immediately to stage tip. Place remaining TMT-labeled peptides at -20 oC until after a ratio check.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":208,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eskb","text":"After the sample flows through the stage tip, wash it with 200 μL 5% ACN/1% FA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63h41","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"jb9c","text":"Elute the stage tip into an MS vial with 80 μL of 80% ACN","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"48gpg","text":"Dry the sample in a speed vacuum and then resuspend the dried peptides in 5% ACN/5% FA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8nfm","text":"Perform a ratio check search with MS. Ensure that TMT labeling is \u003e95%, otherwise add more TMT labeling reagent to each tube and repeat the stage tip + ratio check.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qes7","text":"Quench each tube with hydroxylamine at a final concentration of 0.5% (wt/v). With the volumes above, add 1.1 μL of 50% (wt/v) hydroxylamine solution. Vortex then incubate at RT for 15 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2f6gv","text":"Pool equal amounts of peptides from each channel depending on the ratio check search. Note potential outliers from the ratio check search (e.g., one sample that was not represented, or was very low input).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3eoi8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o0c7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ncd7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7h2sm","text":"If one channel is far below the remainder of the channels, we often load based on the second lowest channel.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67ugl","text":"Fractionate the sample with the High pH Reversed-Phase Peptide Fractionation Kit (Thermo 84868). Follow most of the manufacturer's instructions, but elute with the following 12 fractions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b63t5","text":"Dry samples in the speed vacuum. This will likely take several hours (\u003e 4 h).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65qr4","text":"Combine fractions 1 and 7; 2 and 8; 3 and 9; 4 and 10; 5 and 11; 6 and 12. This concatenates the sample space to 6 fractions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fuk18","text":"Dry these fractions on a speed vacuum. They will dry at different rates, and likely take between 4 and 8 h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rohm","text":"Resuspend samples in 200 μL of 3% ACN/1% FA. Check that pH is ~2, otherwise, further acidify with small amounts of 100% FA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9vghm","text":"200 μL 100% Methanol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dbmbb","text":"Prepare 6 stage tips (12 small cookies from Empore SPE C18 disks, or a commercial C18 column) and equilibrate them:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"70lph","text":"200 μL 5% ACN/1% Formic acid (FA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9nttq","text":"Load sample. Collect this flow-through and save it at -20.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8tpi7","text":"200 μL 5% ACN/1% Formic acid (FA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"71r7h","text":"200 μL 80% ACN","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e92ii","text":"Dry these stage-tipped fractions on a speed vacuum. They will dry at different rates, and likely take between 2 and 4 h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7oppq","text":"Elute stage tips into an MS vials with 80 μL of 80% ACN","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5e4rj","text":"Resuspend the dried peptides in 8 μL of 5% ACN/5% FA, and proceed to MS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: APEX2-based proximity biotinylation of NLRP3 and P4C (SidC) during inflammasome activation
title_html: APEX2-based proximity biotinylation of NLRP3 and P4C (SidC) during inflammasome activation

versions.title: APEX2-based proximity biotinylation of NLRP3 and P4C (SidC) during inflammasome activation
versions.title_html: APEX2-based proximity biotinylation of NLRP3 and P4C (SidC) during inflammasome activation
